intro: Utricularia juncea f. minima, commonly known as the miniature bladderwort, is a diminutive aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and specialized bladder-like structures used for capturing prey. This epiphytic or submerged plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Its flowers are usually small and pale, often appearing in clusters. The species is notable for its unique adaptations to nutrient-poor aquatic habitats.
